cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.current_location: about 175 miles SW of Fort Myers, Florida (230 miles SSW of Tampa)
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast, expected to make landfall along the west-central Florida coast on Thursday and then accelerate northeastward across north-central Florida and into the western Atlantic off the GA/SC coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central Florida coast near the Tampa–Cedar Key area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Anna Maria Island to Yankeetown FL; Tropical Storm Watch north of Suwannee River to Aucilla River FL and portions of western Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning Dry Tortugas and from Bonita Beach to Suwannee River FL; Storm Surge Watch Bonita Beach to Steinhatchee River FL including Tampa Bay and Charlotte Harbor
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida peninsula (west coast), Big Bend, north Florida, then coastal Georgia and South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (<10%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; gusts 25–35 mph possible Friday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation (generally <2 ft) possible with onshore flow during Friday high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible Friday into early Saturday as Eta’s remnants pass offshore
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and rip currents that could disrupt vessel scheduling and cargo handling operations
